Package hac.services

Class RoomService

java.lang.Object
hac.services.RoomService
@Service public class RoomService extends Object
Service class for managing rooms in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • RoomService

      public RoomService()

  • Method Details

    • createNewRoom

      @Transactional public void createNewRoom(Player player, int type)
      Creates a new room and adds a player to it. Locks the database write operation during execution to ensure thread safety.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player instance to be added to the new room.
      type - An integer representing the type of the room, corresponds to an index in the Board.Options enum.

    • addPlayerToRoom

      @Transactional public void addPlayerToRoom(long roomId, Player newPlayer)
      Adds a new player to an existing room, identified by the room's ID. Locks the database write operation during execution to ensure thread safety.
      Parameters:
      roomId - The ID of the Room to which the player will be added.
      newPlayer - The Player instance to be added to the room.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the room does not exist, or if the player is already in a room.

    • getAllRooms

      public List<Room> getAllRooms()
      Retrieves all existing rooms. Locks the database read operation during execution to ensure thread safety.
      Returns:
      A List of all Room instances.

    • updateRoomStatusByUsername

      @Transactional public void updateRoomStatusByUsername(String username, boolean toLockDB, boolean toLockRoom)
      Updates the status of the room associated with the specified user. The method can lock a database and room based on passed parameters.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user whose room's status should be updated.
      toLockDB - Boolean indicating if database lock is required.
      toLockRoom - Boolean indicating if room lock is required.

    • getAllOpponentNamesByUsername

      public List<String> getAllOpponentNamesByUsername(String username, boolean toLockDB, boolean toLockRoom)
      Retrieves the usernames of all the opponents in the room of the specified user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user whose opponents' usernames are to be retrieved.
      toLockDB - Boolean indicating if database lock is required.
      toLockRoom - Boolean indicating if room lock is required.
      Returns:
      A List of usernames of the opponents.

    • getPlayerUsernameTurn

      public String getPlayerUsernameTurn(String username, boolean toLockDB, boolean toLockRoom)
      Retrieves the username of the player whose turn it is in the room of the specified user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user whose room's current player's username is to be retrieved.
      toLockDB - Boolean indicating if database lock is required.
      toLockRoom - Boolean indicating if room lock is required.
      Returns:
      The username of the player whose turn it is.

    • checkIfBothUsersAreInSameRoom

      private void checkIfBothUsersAreInSameRoom(String currentUserName, String opponentUserName)
      Checks if two users are in the same room. If not, throws a DbError.
      Parameters:
      currentUserName - The username of the first user.
      opponentUserName - The username of the second user.
      Throws:
      DbError - If the two users are not in the same room.

    • validateTurn

      private void validateTurn(String username)
      Validates if it is the turn of the specified user. If not, throws an InvalidChoiceError.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to validate.
      Throws:
      InvalidChoiceError - If it's not the user's turn.

    • checkIfGameFinished

      private void checkIfGameFinished(Room room)
      Checks if the game in the specified room has finished. Throws a GameOver exception if the game is over. This function assumes that the calling function has locked the DBLock and the room's lock.
      Parameters:
      room - The room where the game to check is located.
      Throws:
      GameOver - If the game is over.

    • validatePlayersOnGame

      private void validatePlayersOnGame(Room room)
      Validates that all players in the specified room are in game. Throws a RuntimeException if not all players are in game. This function assumes that both the DBLock and the room's lock are locked.
      Parameters:
      room - The room where the game to validate is located.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If not all players are in game.

    • setUpdates

      @Transactional public void setUpdates(String currentUserName, UserTurn userTurn)
      Processes and applies the updates of the game based on a user's turn.
      Parameters:
      currentUserName - The username of the current player.
      userTurn - The user's turn details.

    • getUpdates

      private List<UpdateObject> getUpdates(String username, int timestamp)
      Retrieves a list of update objects for the specified user starting from a specific timestamp. The function assumes that the DBLock and the room's lock are locked.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user whose updates are to be retrieved.
      timestamp - The timestamp from where to start retrieving the updates.
      Returns:
      A list of UpdateObject instances.

    • setGameOver

      @Transactional public void setGameOver(Room room, String winnerName, boolean toLockDB, boolean toLockRoom)
      Sets the game over status for the room and updates player statuses. The function can lock database and room based on passed parameters.
      Parameters:
      room - The room where the game has ended.
      winnerName - The name of the winning player.
      toLockDB - Boolean indicating if database lock is required.
      toLockRoom - Boolean indicating if room lock is required.

    • getBoardOptionByUsername

      private Board.Options getBoardOptionByUsername(String username)
      Retrieves the board option by username. The function assumes that DBLock and room DB are locked for reading.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose board option is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The board option of the user.

    • setExecutor

      private void setExecutor(Long roomId)
      Sets the executor service for the room with the given ID. The function assumes that DBLock is locked for writing.
      Parameters:
      roomId - The ID of the room for which the executor service is to be set.
      Throws:
      DbError - If the key is already in the map.

    • getExecutorServiceForRoom

      private ExecutorService getExecutorServiceForRoom(String username)
      Retrieves the executor service for the room where the user with the specified username is located. The function assumes that the method that locks this has locked the DB for reading.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user whose room's executor service is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The executor service of the room.

    • shutdownExecutorServiceForRoom

      private void shutdownExecutorServiceForRoom(Long roomId)
      Shuts down the executor service for the room with the given ID. The function assumes that the method that locks this has locked the DB for writing.
      Parameters:
      roomId - The ID of the room for which the executor service is to be shut down.

    • handleStatusRoomPolling

      public org.springframework.web.context.request.async.DeferredResult<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> handleStatusRoomPolling(Principal principal, org.springframework.web.context.request.async.DeferredResult<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> output)
      Handles the status room polling.
      Parameters:
      principal - The authenticated user.
      output - The deferred result for the polling.
      Returns:
      The deferred result with the updated status.

    • handleUpdatePolling

      public org.springframework.web.context.request.async.DeferredResult<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> handleUpdatePolling(Principal principal, org.springframework.web.context.request.async.DeferredResult<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> output, int timestamp)
      Handles the update polling.
      Parameters:
      principal - The authenticated user.
      output - The deferred result for the polling.
      timestamp - The timestamp of the last update.
      Returns:
      The deferred result with the updates.

    • setOnGameModel

      public void setOnGameModel(org.springframework.ui.Model model, String username)
      Sets up the game model for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      model - The Model in which the game details will be stored.
      username - The name of the user for whom the model will be set.

    • validateGameMode

      private void validateGameMode(Room room)
      Validates the game mode. This function assumes that DBLock and the room's lock are both locked.
      Parameters:
      room - The room for which the game mode will be validated.
      Throws:
      DbError - if the room is not on_game status.

    • setGameInitModel

      public void setGameInitModel(org.springframework.ui.Model model, String username)
      Sets up the game initialization model for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      model - The Model in which the game initialization details will be stored.
      username - The name of the user for whom the model will be set.

    • getValidationErrorForInitGame

      public String getValidationErrorForInitGame(String username, Boolean lockDb, Boolean lockRoom)
      Validates the state in /game/init for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      username - The name of the user to validate.
      lockDb - Flag to determine whether the database should be locked for this operation.
      lockRoom - Flag to determine whether the room should be locked for this operation.
      Returns:
      A String message indicating any validation errors. Null if no errors are found.

    • saveNewBoard

      @Transactional public void saveNewBoard(Board board, String username)
      Saves a new board for a specific user. This method is annotated with @Transactional, meaning it should be run in a transaction context.
      Parameters:
      board - The board to be saved.
      username - The name of the user for whom the board will be saved.

    • removePlayer

      @Transactional public void removePlayer(String username) throws RuntimeException
      Removes a player from the game. This method is annotated with @Transactional, meaning it should be run in a transaction context.
      Parameters:
      username - The name of the player to be removed.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException

    • validatePlayerInRoomStatus

      public void validatePlayerInRoomStatus(String username) throws Exception
      Validates the status of a player in a room.
      Parameters:
      username - The name of the player to be validated.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the player tries to enter an incorrect room.
